title: Getting started with oddsapiR
code: # You can install using the pacman package using the following code: if (!requireNamespace('pacman', quietly = TRUE)){   install.packages('pacman') } pacman::p_load_current_gh("sportsdataverse/oddsapiR", dependencies = TRUE, update = TRUE) pacman::p_load_current_gh("jthomasmock/gtExtras", dependencies = TRUE, update = TRUE) pacman::p_load(dplyr, knitr, gt)

title: Getting started with oddsapiR
text: Odds API requires API key, ’s quick run-: Using key: can save key consistent usage adding ODDS_API_KEY=XXXX--API-KEY--XXXXX .Renviron file (easily accessed via usethis::edit_r_environ()). Run usethis::edit_r_environ(), new script pop open named .Renviron, paste following new script pops (without quotations) Save script restart RStudio session, clicking Session (Plots Build) click Restart R (also exists shortcut Ctrl + Shift + F10 restart session). set correctly, able use functions without changes. less consistent usage: beginning every session within R environment, save API key environment variable ODDS_API_KEY (quotations) using command like following.

title: Getting started with oddsapiR
text: toa_sports_keys - sports Odds API provides coverage

title: Getting started with oddsapiR
text: One endpoint looking sports API provides (including currently active status): toa_sports One endpoint looking current odds API: toa_sports_odds Note: two entries per event per bookmaker spreads sides event. One endpoint looking current scores API: toa_sports_scores
code: oddsapiR::toa_sports(all_sports = TRUE) %>%   head(n=10) %>%    gt() %>%    gtExtras::gt_theme_538(table.width = px(550)) oddsapiR::toa_sports_odds(sport_key = 'americanfootball_nfl',                            regions = 'us',                            markets = 'spreads',                            odds_format = 'decimal',                           date_format = 'iso') %>%    dplyr::select(c("bookmaker","market_key", "outcomes_name","outcomes_price","outcomes_point","home_team","away_team","commence_time")) %>%    head(n=20) %>%    knitr::kable() oddsapiR::toa_sports_scores(sport_key = 'americanfootball_nfl',                              days_from = NULL,                             date_format = 'iso') %>%    head(n=20) %>%    knitr::kable()

title: oddsapiR
text: can install released version oddsapiR GitHub :
code: # You can install using the pacman package using the following code: if (!requireNamespace('pacman', quietly = TRUE)){   install.packages('pacman') } pacman::p_load_current_gh("sportsdataverse/oddsapiR") # if you would prefer devtools installation if (!requireNamespace('devtools', quietly = TRUE)){   install.packages('devtools') } # Alternatively, using the devtools package: devtools::install_github(repo = "sportsdataverse/oddsapiR") git clone https://github.com/sportsdataverse/oddsapi cd oddsapi Rscript -e "devtools::install()"

title: Find odds for the sports which are accessible through the Odds API — toa_sports_odds
text: sport_key sport_key look odds . See toa_sports() full lookup sport_key values. regions region pull odds . Options include: us uk us eu au Multiple can specified comma delimited. markets type odds return. Multiple can specified comma delimited. Options include: h2h spreads totals odds_format format return odds. Options include: decimal american date_format Date format. Options include: iso unix

title: Find odds for the sports which are accessible through the Odds API — toa_sports_odds
text: Sports Odds API provides betting information tibble:

title: oddsapiR 0.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-06-22 Added NEWS.md file track changes package. toa_sports(): Get Sports Odds API provides coverage toa_sports_odds(): Get odds sports Odds API provides coverage toa_sports_scores(): Get scores sports Odds API provides coverage toa_requests(): Get usage remaining calls key Odds API Tests added functions.
